Description: Ovoid marl pottery jar with small flat base, convex sides, two pierced cylindrical handles on the shoulder and a flat ledge rim; decorated in red paint with wavy-lines encircling the entire body.
Curator's comments: Decorated ware D8g in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). The decoration may imitate the veins on stone vessels, which were carved in the same shape.
